# NSTouch.Phase

**Structure**

The possible phases of a touch.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Phase
```

## Overview

These constants are used by [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouch/phase-swift.property].

## Creating a Touch Phase

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a new touch phase from the given raw value.

## Constants

- **began**: A finger touched the device. Or, a resting touch transitioned to an active touch and resting touches are not wanted by the view hierarchy.
- **moved**: A finger moved on the device.
- **stationary**: A finger is touching the device, but hasn’t moved since the previous event.
- **ended**: A finger was lifted from the screen. Or, an active touch transitioned to a resting touch and resting touches are not wanted by the view hierarchy.
- **cancelled**: The system cancelled tracking for the touch, as when (for example) the window associated with the touch resigns key or is deactivated.
- **touching**: Matches the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouch/Phase-swift.struct/began], [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouch/Phase-swift.struct/moved], or [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTouch/Phase-swift.struct/stationary] phases of a touch.
- **any**: Matches any phase of a touch.

## Using Touch Properties

- **identity**: The changes to a particular touch during its lifetime.
- **phase**: The current phase of the touch.
- **normalizedPosition**: The normalized position of the touch.
- **isResting**: The indicator for a resting touch.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- ExpressibleByArrayLiteral
- OptionSet
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
- SetAlgebra
